body_content.explanation: not planned, especially as part of an event or activity:
examples: An unprogrammed performance of a new work by a young composer preceded the advertised programme.

body_content.explanation: In Quaker groups (= a Christian religious group called the Society of Friends), an unprogrammed meeting is one where there is no planned ceremony and people sit in silence until someone wants to speak:
examples: Unprogrammed meetings do not have a pastor and the leadership role is a volunteer position assumed by a meeting member.

body_content.explanation: (of computers or computer equipment) not given a set of instructions to operate in a particular way:
examples: This is an unprogrammed control module and requires a smart card and reader to program it.

body_content.explanation: (of a cell) not given instructions by the body to become a particular type of cell and therefore able to develop into any type of cell:
examples: These unprogrammed embryonic stem cells have the ability to become any cell in the body.
